title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Wednesday, July 19 (game #541)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: YouTube testing new double-speed video playback control for more video in less time
description: YouTube is currently offering access to experimental quality-of-life changes but only if you're a Premium subscriber.

title: Nvidia launches 16GB RTX 4060 Ti GPU, doesn't bother telling anyone
description: Reviewers didn't receive review samples of the 16GB RTX 4060 Ti graphics card before Nvidia launched it, which is unusual

title: The iPhone 16 Pro Max camera might finally challenge Samsung in one key area
description: The biggest iPhone yet could have the biggest iPhone zoom camera yet, according to a new report coming out of China.

title: Android users are being tricked into installing malicious browser apps - here's how to stay safe
description: Hackers were spotted using a novel technique to deliver malware to users across multiple countries.

title: Splunk integrates with another cloud giant in the name of digital resilience
description: Splunk has announced its partnership with Microsoft to bring its products to the Azure Marketplace

title: A top WordPress plugin is being hacked to hijack websites
description: Hackers are going after unpatched WordPress sites via hacks to the WooCommerce Payments plugin.

title: Loot boxes to be restricted by UK games industry trade association
description: The UK's games industry trade association has revealed an 11-point plan to restrict loot box purchases.

title: The OnePlus 12’s release date may have just been leaked
description: The OnePlus 12 has been rumored to be launching in China at the end of the year, with a global release assumed for February of next year.

title: Baldur's Gate 3 release date, gameplay and news
description: Baldur's Gate 3's release date is just around the corner. Here's everything we know so far, including a look at gameplay.

title: How to play Google's new AR Space Invaders game on Android and iOS
description: Honor the 45th anniversary of Space Invaders in the best way possible – by blasting aliens out of the sky in Google's AR shoot 'em up.

title: Google Bard's upcoming extensions could make it my new travel buddy
description: Travel-focused extensions may come to Google Bard a lot sooner than you think.

title: Activision may have accidentally confirmed Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 this year
description: Modern Warfare 3 was potentially confirmed by Activision thanks to wording in various DMCA strikes.

title: TikTok for iPhone is getting passkeys
description: Top social media platform TikTok is implementing secure passwordless login for iPhone users.

title: The basic Google Workspace tier now includes a code-free app creator
description: More Google Workspace users are getting free access to its code-free app creator, but paying customers will have to cancel manually.

title: Thousands of potentially secret US military emails are being sent to an African country due to typos
description: Emails destined for .mil US military addresses accidentally sent to .ml accounts.

title: You’ll soon be able to stream Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 on Disney Plus and watch Across The Spider-Verse online
description: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 will be released on Disney Plus in August, while Spider-Man Across the Spider-Verse will be available to rent online.

title: Microsoft brings Copilot to more Windows 11 testers – but it doesn’t seem confident in the AI
description: Microsoft has reasons to be very careful with Copilot, yet it appears to be forging ahead – just in an oddly quiet manner.

title: Genuine iPhone photo rejected by photography contest for looking ‘too AI-ish’
description: Another photo contest has become embroiled in an AI controversy, and we urgently need clarity as to what is and isn't acceptable.

title: Threads will soon get these 3 features to convince you to stay, plus 1 you may hate
description: A leaked document has revealed three important features are coming to Threads, but you might not love its new rate limits.

title: Lenovo’s Aurora Project repairable laptops could be a major breakthrough in the war on e-waste
description: If Lenovo gets it right, the company could dominate eco-friendly tech in the near future.

title: Google is deleting some old Hangouts photos soon, so backup now
description: Some old photos from Google Hangouts and even Gmail are being deleted as part of Album Archive’s deprecation - act now.

title: Peacock raises prices for the first time, but it’s still cheaper than Netflix
description: From August 17, both of Peacock's Premium and Premium Plus subscription tiers will be a little bit more expensive.

title: Leaked Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 images show what the new cover screen can do
description: High-quality leaked images of the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 show a far more useful cover screen than the Z Flip 4 has.

title: There are no plans for any Assassin's Creed Mirage DLC "for now"
description: Ubisoft has said that there are currently "no plans" for any Assassin's Creed DLC.

title: Windows 11 makes life better for PC gamers in two ways with new update
description: Windows 11’s new update is great for high-quality gaming mice, and fixes some annoying errors causing games to crash.

title: Your LG TV will get more free shows in the future… and probably more ads too
description: LG expands focus from purely hardware to a mix of hardware, services and ads.

title: Vodafone and Ericsson team up to provide even faster 5G
description: More flexibility, spectrum efficiency, and energy savings should be coming to 5G networks everywhere.

title: Cities Skylines 2 lets you tread the line between chaos and safety with host of new services
description: Cities Skylines 2 is taking the custom city building to the extreme with a host of new services that can either be used for good or evil

title: Microsoft Teams could soon be ripped from Office 365 if the EU has its way
description: Microsoft is in some pretty hot water in the EU, not least for the potentially illegal bundling of Teams with other services.

title: Neopets is now fully independent again and the NFT project has been scrapped
description: After years of being owned by JumpStart Games, Neopets is now finally an independent online game again after 17 years.

title: Ubisoft announces Assassin's Creed Jade closed beta next month
description: Ubisoft announces start date for Assassin's Creed Codename Jade's closed beta.

title: Payday 3's latest trailer went unseen for nearly a week because the devs hid it too well
description: Payday 3's stealth trailer was fittingly well-hidden on the game's website.

title: New Pixel 8 Pro leak suggests the series won't see a huge leap in performance
description: Google is apparently playing it safe for its next flagship phone as its hardware may be nearly identical to the Pixel 7 Pro.
